FacilityName: Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a) Release prevention and emergency response policies

(a) Release prevention and emergency response policies

The Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC distribution center located in Lititz Pennsylvania will distribute consumer health products for the various consumer products companies that fall within the J&J Group of Consumer Companies. The aerosol products stored and distributed primarily include the following trade names: Rogaine Foam, Neotrogena Sun Block Spray and Aveeno Sun Block Spray. These products each use various amounts (or none) of the follwoing propellants: Butane CAS#106-97-8, Isobutane CAS#75-28-5 and Propane CAS#74-98-6. Of the three(3), the propane amount contained in the aerosols stored on-site does not meet the threshold amounts for inclusion in the RMP.



The consumer aerosol products are typically in metal containers, less than 8 ounces in , including the product ingredients, as well as the propellants. The individual containers are typically packaged in corrugated shippers. The shippers are typically stacked on a pallet, on which there may be 1,000-2,000 individual containers.



The Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC Lititz site is an ISO 14001 certified facility. Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC Lititz is the first pharmaceutical plant in the US to be ISO 14001 certified achieving its' certification in 1997. It is certified by Lloyd's Register Quality Assurance (LRQA). As such, the site receives extensive surveillance audits of it?s' managements system which includes emergency preparedness and response. The Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC Lititz facility is a Charter Member of the EPA national Environmental Performance Track and most recently received the 2003 and 2006 EPA Performance Track Award for the "Most Outstanding Environmental Performance".



Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC Lititz's EHS policy is follows:



"We are committed to continual impr

ovement of our environmental, health and safety performance.



We will strive to be proactive in our efforts to improve production processes and reduce: wastewater discharges, solid and hazardous waste generation, energy consumption, and health and safety risks.



The reduction and elimination or our environmental impacts, health and safety risks is a fundamental consideration in the design and operation of our processes.



We will systematically identify and evaluate potential environmental impacts and health and safety hazards and move towards our goals of zero discharge and an accident free workplace.



We are committed to maintaining comprehensive environmental, health and safety management systems. We will periodically monitor our performance and initiate actions necessary to correct identified deficiencies.



Lititz is committed to complying with all relevant environmental, health and safety legislation, regulations and corporate guidelines.



Lititz is committed to actively supporting public outreach initiatives and programs.



Lititz recognizes that for environmental, health and safety to succeed there must be a cooperative effort dependent on the total commitment of all. Site Leadership earnestly solicits each colleague's assistance as a member of our accident/incident prevention team to help in the recognition and elimination of environmental impacts and safety hazards within the facility. Every colleague has the responsibility to work in an environmentally responsible and safe manner, adhering to applicable job procedures."



(b) Stationary source and regulated substances handled:

The Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC Lititz facility is a Synthetic Minor air source under Title V and has a Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection issued air permit Na. 36-05007. The facility also is covered under the Clean water Act 40CFR 112 for pharmaceutical mixing and compounding. The site has an EPA wastewater permit Na. PAP 120320.

The site is a large quantity generator of hazardous waste and has an EPA ID Number PAD003008943.



The Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC Lititz site is also a PSM site for alcohol.



The Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC Lititz Logistic Center is a regional center for the distribution of consumer healthcare products. Rogaine, Neutrogena Sun Block Spray, and Aveeno Sun Block Spray, aerosol consumer products stored in the Logistic center, are covered by RMP requirements. The propellant in the above products is a mixture of butane, isobutane and propane. Warehouse storage of the above products is the sole RMP applicable processes at the facility. Storage is in cardboard shipping boxes containing twenty four(24) steel cans in a case, 18 cases on a pallet with a propellant weight of 0.125 lbs per case.



(c)    The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps: 

While the chances of a worst-case situation actually occurring are incalculable, such a scenario by definition is within the realm of possibility. That is why Johnson & Johnson Sales and Logistics Company, LLC's first emergency management priority is accidental release prevention.



Worst Case Release Scenarios were modeled using EPA's RMP'' Comp v1.07.



To protect the facility's employees, the surrounding community, and the environment;Johnson and Johnson Sales and Logistics Company operations adhere to the accident-prevention elements required under the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Risk Management Program (RMP) Rule. The facility's manufacturing areas' PSM procedures and policies address all of the required elements of the PSM Standard and RMP Rule Prevention Program 1 elements.



(d)    General accidental release prevention and chemical specific prevention steps

The facility is accessed control via key card and ma

nned guard station. Sprinklers and fire extinguishers are provided. The site has an on-site Emergency Response Team. Annual fire safety inspections of the facility are conducted by Factory Mutual.



(e.) Five year accident history

No reportable incidents have occurred at the facility in the past five years. 



(h) Emergency response program

The facility has an extensive Consolidated Emergency Response Plan that includes the requirements under the Superfund Amendments and Reauthorization Act (SARA) and regularly communicates with the Lititz and Lancaster Emergency Management Agency (LEMA) and local emergency-response organizations on matters pertaining to emergency preparedness and chemical storage. The site has an Emergency Response Team (ERT) trained to 24 hr HAZWOPER standards. ERT members are also trained in medical response procedures. Annual drills are conducted with local emergency management agencies and the facility conducts 6 in-house training drills each year for the site ERT. The drills are designed to train for response to materials found and handled on site. The above noted consumer products are included in the emergency response plans.



(i) Planned changes:

None
